Tolkien-related events that took place in 1954.

content.title: January
content.content:
22 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 143.
29 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to the Rector of the University of Liège.
? - Allen & Unwin asks J.R.R. Tolkien to provide suggestions for the dust-jacket designs for the soon-to-be-published The Fellowship of the Ring.[1][2]:p. li

content.title: February
content.content: 23 - Tolkien writes a letter to W.N. Beard saying that he has nor time nor inspiration to draw dust-jacket covers, but he does soon later anyway.[1][2]:p. li

content.title: March
content.content:
16 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 143a.
23 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 143b.
24 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 143c.
26 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 143d.
? - Christopher Tolkien draws a final version of A Part of the Shire map for publication.[2]:p. lv
? - J.R.R. Tolkien draws a cover design for The Return of the King.[2]:p. li

content.title: April
content.content:
14 - Comics writer Charles Dixon is born.
15 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 143e.
25 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letter 144.
30 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to Stanley Unwin.
30 - Programmer Don Woods is born.

content.title: May
content.content:
3 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 144a.
8–15 - J.R.R. Tolkien is in Cambridge as an elector for the chair of Medieval and Renaissance English, a post designed for C.S. Lewis.
13 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letter 145.
17 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to Henry Willink.
22 - J.R.R. Tolkien has a formal dinner in Cambridge.
26 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to W.N. Beard.

content.title: June
content.content:
4 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letter 146.
10 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 146a.
15 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letter 147.

content.title: July
content.content:
20 - J.R.R. Tolkien receives a D. Litt. from University College Dublin.
29 - The Fellowship of the Ring, the first volume of The Lord of the Rings, is published.

content.title: August
content.content:
7 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letter 148.
14 - C.S. Lewis reviews The Fellowship of the Ring for Time and Tide.
18 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 148a.
21 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to Nevill Coghill.

content.title: September
content.content:
9 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letter 149.
9 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to the Rector of the University of Liège.
18 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letters 150 and 151.
22 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letter 152.
25 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letter 154.

content.title: October
content.content:
2 - J.R.R. Tolkien receives an honorary doctorate from the University of Liège.
18 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to the Rector of the University of Liège.
19 - Actor Ken Stott is born.
21 - The American edition of The Fellowship of the Ring is published by the Houghton Mifflin Company.[3]
31 – "The Hero Is a Hobbit", a review by W.H. Auden of The Fellowship of the Ring, is published.

content.title: November
content.content:
4 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letter 156.
6 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to R.W. Burchfield.
7 - Guy Gavriel Kay, who would assist Christopher Tolkien with the writing of The Silmarillion, is born.
11 - The Two Towers, the second volume of The Lord of the Rings, is published.
17 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to Rayner Heppenstall.
22 - Rayner Heppenstall writes a letter to J.R.R. Tolkien.
27 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letter 157.

content.title: December
content.content:
1 - J.R.R. Tolkien starts writing a letter to Rayner Heppenstall.
2 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letter 158.
2 - J.R.R. Tolkien finishes writing a letter to Rayner Heppenstall.
3 - The BBC Third Programme broadcasts the radio play of The Homecoming of Beorhtnoth.
13 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to Rayner Heppenstall.
14 - James Horan, who would voice several characters in video games, is born.
20 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 158a.
25 - Singer Annie Lennox is born.
